alert.note: Alert for Cuming; Dodge; Washington (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 05 at 8:20PM CDT until August 05 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN BURT...SOUTHEASTERN CUMING...NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON AND NORTHEASTERN DODGE COUNTIES... At 820 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Uehling, or 13 miles southeast of West Point, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Oakland, Uehling, and Craig. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northeastern and east central Nebraska. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
